{{also|Anfängen}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|anvahen||to grab on}}, from {{m|gmh|an||on}} + {{m|gmh|vahen||to grab}}, corresponding to {{prefix|de|an|fangen}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈanˌfaŋən/|[ˈanˌfaŋən]|[ˈanˌfaŋŋ̩]}} * {{audio|de|De-anfangen.ogg|Audio}} * {{hyphenation|de|an|fan|gen}} * {{audio|de|De-at-anfangen.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=7|fängt an|fing an|angefangen|auxiliary=[[haben]] or [[sein]]}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[begin]]; to [[commence]] #: ''Das Konzert '''fängt''' gleich '''an'''.'' #:: The concert is '''beginning''' shortly. # {{lb|de|intransitive|with {{l|de|zu}} + infinitive}} to [[start]] doing something #: ''Wann hast du '''angefangen''' zu rauchen?'' #:: When did you '''start''' smoking? # {{lb|de|intransitive|with {{l|de|mit}}}} to [[begin]] something; to [[start]] something #: ''Morgen '''fangen''' wir mit dem Projekt '''an'''.'' #:: Tomorrow we are '''starting''' the project. # {{lb|de|intransitive|with {{l|de|von}}}} to [[start]] a topic; to keep talking about something #: ''Er '''fängt''' ständig von seinen Hunden '''an'''.'' #:: He’s always '''talking''' about his dogs. # {{lb|de|transitive|colloquial}} to [[begin]] something; to [[start]] something #: ''Wann hast du das Rauchen '''angefangen'''?'' #:: When did you '''start''' smoking? #: ''Morgen '''fangen''' wir das Projekt '''an'''.'' #:: Tomorrow we are '''starting''' the project. ====Usage notes==== * The normal auxiliary for this verb is {{m|de|haben}}: ''Ich habe angefangen.'' – "I have begun." The auxiliary {{m|de|sein}} is however used by some speakers in northwestern Germany in everyday speech: ''Ich bin angefangen.'' (Many and probably almost all of these speakers however use the standard forms in formal contexts in speech and writing.) It is conceivable that this usage is due to influence by the same construction in Dutch {{m|nl|beginnen||to begin}}: ''Ik ben begonnen.'').[https://www.philhist.uni-augsburg.de/de/lehrstuehle/germanistik/sprachwissenschaft/ada/runde_4/f01c/ Atlas zur deutschen Alltagssprache: ist/hat angefangen ] * The construction of ''anfangen'' as a transitive verb (sense 4) is perfectly acceptable in spoken German, but would not be common in formal writing. ===References=== ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|fang|fing|gefangen|h||fäng||a|a|an|a}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|beginnen}} {{qualifier|less frequent in common speech}} * {{l|de|starten}} {{qualifier|not always applicable}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Anfangen}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|Anfang|g=m}} * {{l|de|Anfänger|g=m}} * {{l|de|anfänglich}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Swedish== ===Noun=== {{head|sv|noun form}} # {{sv-noun-form-def|anfang}}
